definition: to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
see 養老金雙軌制|养老金双轨制[yang3 lao3 jin1 shuang1 gui3 zhi4]
pinyin: tui4 xiu1 jin1 shuang1 gui3 zhi4

sentences.english: Retirement accounts and savings, they say, have been drained to pay legal fees.
sentences.chinese: 用来支付诉讼费用的退休金账户和储蓄已被耗尽。

sentences.english: He lives on the retirement pension.
He commuted his pension into〔for〕 a lump sum.
sentences.chinese: 他把退休金一次领清，拿了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan owns 10,7% of company shares.
sentences.chinese: 安大略教师退休金计划拥有10个，7%的公司股票。

sentences.english: She was pregnant with the child of a KGB officer and now lives on a BND pension in southern Germany.
sentences.chinese: 如今她依靠德国联邦情报局的退休金在德国南部生活。

sentences.english: A woman who has recently re-entered the workforce should make sure she's maxing out her own retirement accounts.
sentences.chinese: 近期再入职场的女性应确保其存有足够的退休金。

sentences.english: Since then he has been drawing a pension.
sentences.chinese: 从那时起他一直领退休金。

sentences.english: She pays for neutering and food from her pension and donations.
sentences.chinese: 她支付，绝育及食物从她的退休金和捐赠。

sentences.english: Instead of protesting this pension reform, young people should celebrate pension reform.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人应该庆祝退休金改革而非进行反对示威。

sentences.english: They don't really have to worry about their pensions.
sentences.chinese: 他们其实并不需要担心自己的退休金。

sentences.english: Teachers now have to come under the State Superannuation Scheme.
sentences.chinese: 现在的教师得纳入国家退休金体系。

sentences.english: Find out about unemployment insurance, health insurance, pension benefits and severance pay.
sentences.chinese: 看看有样的失业保险，健康保险，退休金福利遣散费。

sentences.english: Some people can take advantage of our early retirement package.
sentences.chinese: 有些人还可以领到我们的提早退休金。

sentences.english: The retirement age will have risen to 70 by the time people reach pensionable age.
sentences.chinese: 人们领取全额退休金的年龄将进步至70岁。

sentences.english: Neveu says the reforms are unfair.
sentences.chinese: 内沃说，退休金改革是不公平的。

sentences.english: My entire monthly pension of $147 is spent on food.
sentences.chinese: 我一个月的退休金是147块美元，全用在菜市场了。

definition: subsistence allowance/welfare (abbr. for 城市居民最低生活保障[cheng2 shi4 ju1 min2 zui4 di1 sheng1 huo2 bao3 zhang4])
social insurance/abbr. for 社會保險|社会保险
